and logic programming in particular.

content.html:
TL;DR Installation script

I eventually figured how to find motivation
to install Eagle Mode by reading its documentation
so that optional dependencies are fully leveraged,
less than 4 ans years later üí™üèº,
(not suffering from inertia at all)

Conclusion: please don't be hasty

¬†

Who needs the whateverses, when you can just browse a linux filesystem
in some ~orderly fashions with Eagle Mode :P

Thank you Andre Staltz for showing us the way since this publication of yours:

Yep. All the way down to the bytes of each file, if you wish. pic.twitter.com/DT3vGodrR6

‚Äî Andr√© Staltz (@andrestaltz) December 31, 2018

[‚Ä¶]

It turned out that I missed a third party repository,
mentioning circa 2019 that probonopd/eaglemode exists,
from the 2018 thread above ü§Ø
(publication since deleted by its author, hence redacted below).

¬†

It was only after intending to thank
the author (Oliver Hamann) from the project forum
that i had this realized.

Related links :

  • Eagle Mode's video demonstration

Tags:

  • #eagle
    • #mode
  • #filesystem
  • #linux

All the way down to the bytes of each file, if you wish. pic.twitter.com/DT3vGodrR6‚Äî Andr√© Staltz (@andrestaltz) December 31, 2018[‚Ä¶]It turned out that I missed a third party repository,mentioning circa 2019 that probonopd/eaglemode exists,from the 2018 thread above ü§Ø(publication since deleted by its author, hence redacted below).¬† Publication referring to github repository packaged as an AppImage installable for linux distributions It was only after intending to thank the author (Oliver Hamann) from the project forumthat i had this realized.Related links :

content.html:

de conteneurs par la modification du fichier de configuration suivant : /etc/docker/daemon.json¬†

[‚Ä¶] 
"log-driver": "json-file",
"log-opts": {"max-size": "10g", "max-file": "20"}
[‚Ä¶]

d√©couverte via r√©ponse en lien depuis @StackOverflow
